jobTitle: Vice President of Population Health Strategy
description:
### Why Consider This Opportunity?

#### Collaborative Leadership

  • Work alongside an experienced Chief Executive Officer with a clinical background and a thorough understanding of the Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC) model.

#### Team Building and Growth

  • Join a cohesive leadership team focused on continuous growth through consultant-driven programs and advanced leadership training.

#### Population Health Management

  • Engage in the Population Health Management Initiative, collaborating with major health organizations to enhance care quality and address health disparities.

#### Expansion and Innovation

  • Contribute to an entrepreneurial environment aimed at expanding health center services and increasing access to care.

#### Balanced Workload

  • Benefit from a workload divided into 60% administrative and 40% clinical, enabling you to focus on high-level responsibilities while maintaining clinical skills.

#### Professional Networking

  • Expand your professional network through participation in regional consortiums and advisory committees, with the support of the CEO.

#### Mission-Driven Team

  • Join a dedicated team focused on improving access to high-quality healthcare services in underserved communities.

#### Educational Opportunities

  • Involve yourself in clinical activities with a residency program and pursue faculty appointments through established relationships with medical schools.

### The Role You'll Play

  • As the primary leader, you will oversee medical services across multiple health center locations, emphasizing population health and the integration of healthcare services. Your mission will be to deliver high-quality care, ensure patient access, and provide exceptional customer service to underserved communities.

### Background Profile

#### Education

  • Board Certified MD/DO in Family Practice or Internal Medicine.

#### Experience

  • Demonstrated clinical leadership experience in a Federally Qualified Health Center, such as Site Medical Director, Associate Medical Director, Deputy CMO, or CMO.

#### Skills

  • Strong project management capabilities, adept at leading strategic implementation and employing a systems-change-oriented approach.

#### Leadership

  • Proven ability to inspire and lead provider groups, advocate for the organization, and effectively manage competing priorities.

#### Communication

  • Excellent active listening skills, with a talent for articulating the rationale behind changes and adjusting processes to meet goals.

Employment Type: Full-Time
